abstract: Newly revealed testimony is raising questions about whether federal regulators overstepped their bounds in pressing Bank of America’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Newly revealed testimony is raising questions about whether federal regulators overstepped their bounds in pressing Bank of America’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Newly revealed testimony about federal involvement in the Bank of America acquisition of Merrill Lynch is raising questions about whether bank regulators may have overstepped during a period of extreme stress in the financial system.

abstract: An article in Business Day on Friday about new revelations in testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank's acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the name of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner, not Bonder.
lead_paragraph: An article in Business Day on Friday about new revelations in testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank's acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the name of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner, not Bonder.
